author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Institution of Engineers, India (IEI) in association with Sona College of Technology and Thiagarajar Polytechnic College organised the 30th national convention of computer engineers and national seminar on the theme “data mining techniques and recent trends’’ recently.

K.P. Ramanathan, chairman, Tamil Nadu State Centre, IEI, was the guest of honour and he spoke about data mining and how to transfer data for productive use.

Sessions

The technical discussions were held on the recent trends of data mining in the fields of Biological data analysis, financial data analysis, telecommunication industry, retail industry, and intrusion detection.

Report

A detailed report on the technical sessions and their outcome will shortly be submitted to the government and Research and Development centres for perusal and follow up action, Mr. Ramanathan said. C. Valliappa, chairman, Sona Group of Institutions; Suneel Grover, chairman, Computer Engineering Division Board, IEI; and J. Akilandeswari, organising secretary of the convention, offered felicitations.
title: Seminar held
